body_html:
OP: have you tried using L1 regularization? How big are your model files
after that?

On Monday, November 23, 2015, Vincent Vanhoucke notifications@github.com
wrote:

None yet. gzipping will unlikely result in significant compression due to
the high entropy of the weights, but we're very interested in enabling
compressed model representations at rest in general, especially for models
that have to fit on mobile devices. I'll leave this bug open to track the
feature request.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#338 (comment)
.

OP: have you tried using L1 regularization? How big are your model files
after that?

On Monday, November 23, 2015, Vincent Vanhoucke notifications@github.com
wrote:

> None yet. gzipping will unlikely result in significant compression due to
> the high entropy of the weights, but we're very interested in enabling
> compressed model representations at rest in general, especially for models
> that have to fit on mobile devices. I'll leave this bug open to track the
> feature request.
>
